sections.title: Financial Instruments
sections.description: Checklist for presentation and disclosure requirements under IFRS 9, including related disclosures from IFRS 7, IAS 1, IAS 15, IFRS 17 and IFRS 18 where IFRS 9 is explicitly referenced.

items.question: Has the entity designated a previously recognized financial asset as measured at fair value through profit or loss under IFRS 1.D19A?
items.original_question: If the entity designates a previously recognised financial asset as a financial asset measured at fair value through profit or loss under IFRS 1.D19A, does the entity disclose the fair value of financial assets so designated at the date of designation

decision_tree.question: Has the entity designated a previously recognized financial asset as measured at fair value through profit or loss under IFRS 1.D19A?
decision_tree.guidance: Review entity's transition disclosures as required under IFRS 1 for first-time adoption. Specifically, check if the entity has applied IFRS 1.D19A to any financial asset, changing its measurement category to fair value through profit or loss (FVPL). Look for explicit mentions in the financial statements transition notes.

yes_case.question: Did the entity disclose the fair value of the financial assets designated at fair value through profit or loss at the date of designation?
yes_case.guidance: Check the disclosure notes within the financial statements related to IFRS 1. Ensure the fair value of the relevant financial assets is disclosed at the date of designation, as required by IFRS 1.29. Verify the information provided against valuation reports or supporting documentation for accuracy.

items.question: Has the entity designated a previously recognised financial asset as a financial asset measured at fair value through profit or loss under IFRS 1.D19A?
items.original_question: If the entity designates a previously recognised financial asset as a financial asset measured at fair value through profit or loss under IFRS 1.D19A, does the entity disclose the classification and carrying amount in the previous financial statements

decision_tree.question: Has the entity designated a previously recognised financial asset as a financial asset measured at fair value through profit or loss under IFRS 1.D19A?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial statements and transition disclosures under IFRS 1.D19A. Specifically, check whether any financial asset previously recognised has been reclassified or designated as measured at fair value through profit or loss upon adopting IFRS 9. Look for references to this designation in the entity's accounting policies and transitional adjustments.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the classification and carrying amount of the financial asset as presented in the previous financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Verify if the entity's financial statements disclose (a) the classification under previous accounting standards (e.g., IAS 39) and (b) the carrying amount prior to the transition to IFRS 9. This information must be clearly stated, typically within the transition disclosures section of the financial statements.

items.question: Has the entity designated a previously recognised financial liability as a financial liability at fair value through profit or loss under IFRS 1.D19?
items.original_question: If the entity designates a previously recognised financial liability as a financial liability at fair value through profit or loss under IFRS 1.D19, does the entity disclose the fair value of financial liabilities so designated at the date of designation

decision_tree.question: Has the entity designated a previously recognised financial liability as a financial liability at fair value through profit or loss under IFRS 1.D19?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's policies under IFRS 1 and IFRS 9. Check if the entity has made the optional irrevocable designation of a financial liability to be measured at fair value through profit or loss. Confirm the designation from the notes to the financial statements or accounting policies section.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the fair value of financial liabilities designated at fair value through profit or loss at the date of designation?
yes_case.guidance: Review the disclosures of financial liabilities in the notes to the financial statements. Verify if the fair value of the liabilities designated at fair value through profit or loss is explicitly stated at the date the designation was made. Ensure the disclosure complies with IFRS 1 and IFRS 9 requirements.

items.question: Has the entity designated a previously recognized financial liability as a financial liability at fair value through profit or loss under IFRS 1.D19?
items.original_question: If the entity designates a previously recognised financial liability as a financial liability at fair value through profit or loss under IFRS 1.D19, does the entity disclose the classification and carrying amount in the previous financial statements

decision_tree.question: Has the entity designated a previously recognized financial liability as a financial liability at fair value through profit or loss under IFRS 1.D19?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial statements and accounting policies. Look for references to IFRS 1.D19 and check whether any financial liabilities were reclassified to fair value through profit or loss upon transition to IFRS. Verify supporting documentation for such reclassification.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the classification and carrying amount of the financial liability in the previous financial statements prior to reclassification?
yes_case.guidance: Review the previous financial statements (before IFRS adoption). Confirm that the original classification (e.g., amortized cost or fair value) and carrying amounts of the financial liability are disclosed explicitly or within the applicable notes. Cross-check with IFRS 1.29A for disclosure requirements.

items.question: Does the entity have financial instruments that require disclosure under IFRS 7 or IFRS 9?
items.original_question: If disclosures are required by class of financial instrument, does the entity group financial instruments into classes that are appropriate to the nature of the information disclosed and that take into account the characteristics of those financial instruments

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have financial instruments that require disclosure under IFRS 7 or IFRS 9?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's Statement of Financial Position and associated notes to identify financial instruments (e.g., cash, receivables, investments, derivatives, debt, etc.). Refer to IFRS 7.6 and IFRS 9 for the scope of disclosures. Ensure you account for categories such as financial assets, financial liabilities, and equity instruments.

yes_case.question: Are disclosures required by class of financial instrument based on IFRS 7.6?
yes_case.guidance: Check whether IFRS 7.6 applies to the entity's financial instruments. Disclosures may be required for the entity’s financial instruments by class, depending on their nature and characteristics. Pay special attention to disclosures about risks, measurement bases, and changes.

yes_case.question: Has the entity grouped financial instruments into appropriate classes based on their nature and characteristics?
yes_case.guidance: Review the entity’s financial disclosures. Classes of financial instruments should align with their nature (e.g., loans, equity investments, debt instruments) and characteristics (e.g., contractual terms, risk profiles). Confirm whether the grouping provides meaningful information to the users of financial statements. Refer to IFRS 7.B1-B3 for further guidance.

items.question: Does the entity hold financial instruments that are required to be disclosed by class?
items.original_question: If disclosures are required by class of financial instrument, does the entity provide sufficient information to permit reconciliation to the relevant items in the statement of financial position

decision_tree.question: Does the entity hold financial instruments that are required to be disclosed by class?
decision_tree.guidance: Refer to IFRS 7 paragraphs 6 and B1-B3 to identify if the entity has any financial instruments that fall into the disclosure requirements. Review the statement of financial position and the notes to determine if such instruments exist, and consider their classification (e.g., loans, receivables, investments).

yes_case.question: Does the entity provide sufficient information for each class of financial instrument to allow reconciliation to the relevant items in the statement of financial position?
yes_case.guidance: Refer to specific sections of IFRS 7. Ensure the disclosure provides enough detail to identify how the financial instrument corresponds to line items such as assets or liabilities in the statement of financial position. Confirm the reconciliation is clear and complete, avoiding aggregation that may obscure individual classes of financial instruments.

items.question: Does the entity hold financial assets on its statement of financial position?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose, either in the statement of financial position or in the notes, the carrying amounts of financial assets measured at fair value through profit or loss, showing separately: those designated as such upon initial recognition or subsequently in accordance with IFRS 9.6.7.1, those mandatorily measured at fair value through profit or loss in accordance with IFRS 9, those measured as such in accordance with the election in IFRS 9.3.3.5, and those measured as such in accordance with the election in IAS 32.33A

decision_tree.question: Does the entity hold financial assets on its statement of financial position?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's statement of financial position and identify whether any financial assets are recognized. Financial assets include cash, receivables, investments, derivatives, or other items that meet the definition in IFRS 9.

yes_case.question: Are any of the financial assets measured at fair value through profit or loss?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the entity's accounting policies and disclosures for classification of financial assets. Identify if any assets are measured at fair value through profit or loss (FVTPL) and not at amortized cost or fair value through other comprehensive income (FVOCI).

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the carrying amounts of financial assets measured at FVTPL, showing separately the categories outlined by IFRS 9 and IAS 32?
yes_case.guidance: Check the disclosures provided in the notes or directly in the statement of financial position. Confirm that the financial assets are split into the following categories: (1) those designated at FVTPL upon initial recognition or subsequently as per IFRS 9.6.7.1, (2) those mandatorily measured at FVTPL in accordance with IFRS 9, (3) those measured at FVTPL in accordance with the election in IFRS 9.3.3.5, and (4) those measured at FVTPL in accordance with the election in IAS 32.33A. Ensure the level of detail is sufficient to interpret the entity's classification decisions.

items.question: Does the entity have financial liabilities measured at fair value through profit or loss?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose, either in the statement of financial position or in the notes, the carrying amounts of financial liabilities at fair value through profit or loss, showing separately: those designated as such upon initial recognition or subsequently in accordance with IFRS 9.6.7.1 and those that meet the definition of held for trading in IFRS 9

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have financial liabilities measured at fair value through profit or loss?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements, particularly the statement of financial position and relevant notes. Financial liabilities measured at fair value through profit or loss include those designated as such upon initial recognition or subsequently under IFRS 9. Verify with IFRS 9.6.7.1 and classify liabilities that meet the 'held for trading' definition in IFRS 9.4.1.3. Ensure all liabilities measured at fair value are identified.

yes_case.question: Does the entity separately disclose the carrying amounts of financial liabilities at fair value through profit or loss that are designated as such upon initial recognition or subsequently under IFRS 9.6.7.1?
yes_case.guidance: Check the notes to the financial statements or the statement of financial position for separate presentation. For liability designations per IFRS 9.6.7.1, ensure these are disclosed separately from those that meet the 'held for trading' definition.

yes_case.question: Does the entity separately disclose the carrying amounts of financial liabilities at fair value through profit or loss that meet the definition of 'held for trading' under IFRS 9?
yes_case.guidance: Confirm that liabilities classified as 'held for trading' under IFRS 9.4.1.3 are disclosed separately. Check if this is clearly provided in the notes or the statement of financial position.

items.question: Does the entity have financial assets measured at amortised cost?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose, either in the statement of financial position or in the notes, the carrying amounts of financial assets measured at amortised cost

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have financial assets measured at amortised cost?
decision_tree.guidance: Check the entity's statement of financial position, specifically for line items such as loans receivable or held-to-collect debt instruments. Review accounting policies and assess whether these assets are designated as amortised cost as per IFRS 9.4.1.1-4.1.5. Ensure only items meeting the 'held-to-collect' and SPPI (Solely Payments of Principal and Interest) criteria are included.

yes_case.question: Are the carrying amounts of these financial assets disclosed in the statement of financial position or in the notes?
yes_case.guidance: Review the statement of financial position and accompanying notes. Look for explicit disclosures of carrying amounts relating to financial assets measured at amortised cost (e.g., loans receivable, trade receivables). Confirm that disclosures comply with IFRS 7.8 by providing clarity on the measurement and grouping.

items.question: Does the entity have financial liabilities measured at amortised cost?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose, either in the statement of financial position or in the notes, the carrying amounts of financial liabilities measured at amortised cost

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have financial liabilities measured at amortised cost?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial statements, specifically the statement of financial position and notes. Identify whether there are financial liabilities accounted for using the amortised cost method under IFRS 9. Common examples include loans, bonds, and trade payables, unless designated as measured at fair value. Cross-reference disclosures in IFRS 9.4.1.1-4.1.5 to ensure correct classification.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the carrying amounts of financial liabilities measured at amortised cost either in the statement of financial position or in the notes?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the disclosures provided in the financial statements. Carrying amounts should be explicitly stated and aligned with IFRS 7.8 requirements. Review sections IFRS 9.4.1.2A and IFRS 9.5.7.5 for guidance on presentation and disclosure standards. Ensure the disclosures are either in the statement of financial position or sufficiently detailed in the notes.

no_case.question: Are there specific reasons for the lack of disclosure such as immateriality or omission of required detail?
no_case.guidance: Ensure omissions are justified by legitimate reasoning under IFRS principles such as materiality (IAS 1.31). If omissions appear unjustified, refer to IFRS 7.8 and IAS 32.33A for required disclosures. Confirm whether justification is documented appropriately in the notes.

items.question: Does the entity have financial assets measured at fair value through other comprehensive income (FVOCI)?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose, either in the statement of financial position or in the notes, the carrying amounts of financial assets measured at fair value through other comprehensive income, showing separately: financial assets that are measured at fair value through other comprehensive income in accordance with IFRS 9.4.1.2A and investments in equity instruments designated as such upon initial recognition in accordance with IFRS 9.5.7.5

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have financial assets measured at fair value through other comprehensive income (FVOCI)?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity’s statement of financial position and supporting notes. Look specifically for financial assets accounted for under IFRS 9.4.1.2A or IFRS 9.5.7.5. Confirm whether these assets exist and are measured at FVOCI as per IFRS guidelines.

yes_case.question: Are the financial assets measured at FVOCI disclosed in the statement of financial position or the notes?
yes_case.guidance: Check the entity's financial statements and notes to ensure that the carrying amounts of these financial assets are disclosed either directly on the statement of financial position or within the accompanying notes.

yes_case.question: Are financial assets measured at FVOCI classified separately, showing: (1) financial assets measured at FVOCI under IFRS 9.4.1.2A, and (2) investments in equity instruments designated as FVOCI under IFRS 9.5.7.5?
yes_case.guidance: Ensure the disclosure distinctly separates between financial assets under IFRS 9.4.1.2A and equity investments designated under IFRS 9.5.7.5. This should be clearly identifiable in the notes or on the statement of financial position. Be aware that blending these categories or generalizing as 'FVOCI assets' without further breakdown may lead to clarity issues.

items.question: Has the entity elected to apply the Amendments to IFRS 9 and IFRS 7 in Amendments to the Classification and Measurement of Financial Instruments, issued May 2024?
items.original_question: If an entity applies the Amendments to IFRS 9 and IFRS 7 in Amendments to the Classification and Measurement of Financial Instruments, issued May 2024, in its financial statements for a period beginning before 1 January 2026, does it disclose that it applies all the amendments at the same time

decision_tree.question: Has the entity elected to apply the Amendments to IFRS 9 and IFRS 7 in Amendments to the Classification and Measurement of Financial Instruments, issued May 2024?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's accounting policies and disclosures in the financial statements. Specifically, check if the entity has opted to early adopt the Amendments to IFRS 9 and IFRS 7. Look for explicit mention of these amendments and their effective application date in the notes to the financial statements. Be cautious of cases where policies might reference prior amendments instead of the May 2024 version.

yes_case.question: Is the reporting period beginning before 1 January 2026?
yes_case.guidance: Verify the financial reporting period in the financial statements. Confirm if the start date of the reporting period falls before 1 January 2026. This date check is critical as early adoption is only relevant for periods beginning prior to this date.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose that it applies all the amendments at the same time?
yes_case.guidance: Review the financial statements, specifically the disclosures section. Confirm whether the entity explicitly states that it applies all amendments introduced in May 2024 together, without partial application. Absence of this disclosure violates compliance requirements.

items.question: Does the entity apply the Amendments to IFRS 9 and IFRS 7 in Amendments to the Classification and Measurement of Financial Instruments issued in May 2024?
items.original_question: If an entity applies the Amendments to IFRS 9 and IFRS 7 in Amendments to the Classification and Measurement of Financial Instruments, issued May 2024, in its financial statements for a period beginning before 1 January 2026, does it disclose that it applies only the amendments to the Application Guidance to Section 4.1 (Classification of financial assets) of IFRS 9 for that earlier period

decision_tree.question: Does the entity apply the Amendments to IFRS 9 and IFRS 7 in Amendments to the Classification and Measurement of Financial Instruments issued in May 2024?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the accounting policies and disclosures in the financial statements. Locate the section of accounting policies referring to IFRS 9 and IFRS 7 amendments. Ensure the amendment referenced corresponds to the May 2024 issuance.

yes_case.question: Is the reporting period beginning before 1 January 2026?
yes_case.guidance: Check the reporting period start date in the financial statements. Ensure it falls before 1 January 2026.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose that it applies only the amendments to the Application Guidance to Section 4.1 (Classification of financial assets) of IFRS 9 for that earlier period?
yes_case.guidance: Review the disclosure notes in the financial statements, particularly those regarding IFRS 9 application guidance. Verify that the entity specifies it applies only the amendments to Section 4.1 for the earlier period.

items.question: Have the amendments to the Application Guidance of IFRS 9 Section 4.1 (Classification of financial assets) been applied by the entity?
items.original_question: At the date of initial application of the amendments to the Application Guidance to Section 4.1 of IFRS 9 (Classification of financial assets), does the entity disclose for each class of financial assets that changed measurement category as a result of applying the amendments: the measurement category and carrying amount determined immediately before the amendments were applied

decision_tree.question: Have the amendments to the Application Guidance of IFRS 9 Section 4.1 (Classification of financial assets) been applied by the entity?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the date of initial application of IFRS 9 amendments in the entity’s financial reporting. Check the entity’s accounting policies or disclosures to determine if the amendments have been adopted. Common pitfalls: Ensure the entity's financial statements refer to the specific amendments to Section 4.1 of IFRS 9, and confirm the effective date of adoption aligns with the amendment requirements.

yes_case.question: Did the application of the IFRS 9 amendments result in a change in the measurement category for any class of financial assets?
yes_case.guidance: Verify the classification changes by comparing the entity’s financial assets measurement category before and after the amendments were applied. Inspect the transition disclosures or related section in the financial statements. If no change exists, this disclosure requirement is not applicable.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the measurement category and carrying amount immediately before the amendments were applied for each class of financial assets that changed measurement category?
yes_case.guidance: Check the disclosures in the financial statements, particularly in the notes related to financial assets. Look for specific details of measurement category and carrying amount prior to amendment application. Ensure the details adequately address all affected financial asset categories. Common pitfalls: Missing disclosures or insufficient segregation of financial asset classes.

items.question: Did the entity have financial assets that changed measurement category as a result of applying the amendments to Section 4.1 of IFRS 9 at the date of initial application?
items.original_question: At the date of initial application of the amendments to the Application Guidance to Section 4.1 of IFRS 9 (Classification of financial assets), does the entity disclose for each class of financial assets that changed measurement category as a result of applying the amendments: the measurement category and carrying amount determined immediately after the amendments were applied

decision_tree.question: Did the entity have financial assets that changed measurement category as a result of applying the amendments to Section 4.1 of IFRS 9 at the date of initial application?
decision_tree.guidance: Refer to the amendments to Section 4.1 of IFRS 9 and examine the entity's financial assets classification prior to and immediately after initial application. Verify any changes to the measurement category due to the amendments. Cross-check this information with the entity's accounting policies documentation and supporting schedules. Common pitfalls include overlooking changes in classification for smaller or less material asset classes.

yes_case.question: For each class of financial assets that changed measurement category, does the entity disclose the measurement category and carrying amount determined immediately after applying the amendments?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the disclosures in the financial statements, particularly in the notes. Look for specific information on each class of financial assets affected by the amendments. Ensure completeness by comparing disclosures to requirements under IFRS 9.7.2.49. Verify whether the measurement category and carrying amount are clearly stated. Lack of specificity or incomplete disclosures could lead to non-compliance.

items.question: Has the entity applied the Amendments to IFRS 9 in Annual Improvements to IFRS Accounting Standards – Volume 11, issued July 2024?
items.original_question: If an entity applies the Amendments to IFRS 9 in Annual Improvements to IFRS Accounting Standards – Volume 11, issued July 2024, in its financial statements for a period beginning before 1 January 2026, does it disclose that fact

decision_tree.question: Has the entity applied the Amendments to IFRS 9 in Annual Improvements to IFRS Accounting Standards – Volume 11, issued July 2024?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's accounting policies and disclosures in the financial statements. Ensure that there is documentation in the notes indicating the adoption of the amendments specified in IFRS 9, Volume 11. Common pitfall: The entity may incorrectly claim application without reflecting corresponding changes in disclosures.

yes_case.question: Did the entity apply the amendments for a financial period beginning before 1 January 2026?
yes_case.guidance: Check the period covered by the financial statements to verify whether it begins before 1 January 2026. The entity should provide clear start and end dates of the financial period in its disclosures.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose that it has applied the Amendments to IFRS 9 in Annual Improvements to IFRS Accounting Standards – Volume 11?
yes_case.guidance: Review the disclosures in the financial statements or notes to ensure the entity explicitly states that it has applied these amendments. Common pitfall: Ensure the disclosure is complete, precise, and not buried in broader statements.

items.question: Has the entity designated any financial asset or group of financial assets as measured at fair value through profit or loss, instead of fair value through other comprehensive income or amortised cost?
items.original_question: If the entity has designated a financial asset (or group of financial assets) as measured at fair value through profit or loss that would otherwise be measured at fair value through other comprehensive income or amortised cost, does it disclose the maximum exposure to credit risk (see IFRS 7.36(a)) of the financial asset (or group of financial assets) at the end of the reporting period

decision_tree.question: Has the entity designated any financial asset or group of financial assets as measured at fair value through profit or loss, instead of fair value through other comprehensive income or amortised cost?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the classification of financial assets in the entity's financial statements. Specifically, check the notes to financial assets and IFRS 9-related disclosures to determine if any asset has been designated at fair value through profit or loss despite qualifying for fair value through other comprehensive income or amortised cost. Pay attention to IFRS 9 designation criteria.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the maximum exposure to credit risk for the financial asset (or group of financial assets) at the end of the reporting period?
yes_case.guidance: Check the disclosures under IFRS 7.36(a) in the financial statements. The maximum exposure to credit risk should be disclosed clearly and should include any associated details about the financial asset or group of financial assets. Look for specific quantitative data.

items.question: Has the entity designated a financial asset (or group of financial assets) as measured at fair value through profit or loss (FVTPL), which would otherwise be measured at fair value through other comprehensive income (FVOCI) or amortised cost?
items.original_question: If the entity has designated a financial asset (or group of financial assets) as measured at fair value through profit or loss that would otherwise be measured at fair value through other comprehensive income or amortised cost, does it disclose the amount by which any related credit derivatives or similar instruments mitigate that maximum exposure to credit risk (see IFRS 7.36(b))

decision_tree.question: Has the entity designated a financial asset (or group of financial assets) as measured at fair value through profit or loss (FVTPL), which would otherwise be measured at fair value through other comprehensive income (FVOCI) or amortised cost?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial statements and accounting policies. Look specifically at the note disclosures for financial assets and their measurement bases. Verify whether any assets have been designated as FVTPL under IFRS 9 instead of FVOCI or amortised cost. Check the judgment section where the management might describe why such designation was made.

yes_case.question: Do any related credit derivatives or similar instruments exist to mitigate the maximum exposure to credit risk for these designated financial assets?
yes_case.guidance: Identify if the entity holds any credit derivatives or similar instruments to manage credit risk. Look at the risk management disclosures and IFRS 7.9 for details on the use of derivatives. Confirm whether these instruments are used to reduce the exposure to credit risk for the specified financial assets.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the amount by which these credit derivatives or similar instruments mitigate the maximum exposure to credit risk?
yes_case.guidance: Check the disclosures in the entity's financial statements under IFRS 7.36(b). Specifically, verify whether the amount by which credit derivatives or similar instruments mitigate credit risk is clearly presented. Ensure this disclosure meets the requirements outlined in IFRS 7.36.

items.question: Has the entity designated any financial asset or group of financial assets as measured at fair value through profit or loss (FVPL), which would otherwise be measured at fair value through other comprehensive income (FVOCI) or amortized cost?
items.original_question: If the entity has designated a financial asset (or group of financial assets) as measured at fair value through profit or loss that would otherwise be measured at fair value through other comprehensive income or amortised cost, does it disclose the amount of change, during the period and cumulatively, in the fair value of the financial asset (or group of financial assets) that is attributable to changes in the credit risk of the financial asset determined either: as the change in its fair value that is not attributable to changes in market conditions that give rise to market risk or using an alternative method that the entity believes more faithfully represents the change in its fair value that is attributable to changes in credit risk of the asset

decision_tree.question: Has the entity designated any financial asset or group of financial assets as measured at fair value through profit or loss (FVPL), which would otherwise be measured at fair value through other comprehensive income (FVOCI) or amortized cost?
decision_tree.guidance: Refer to the entity's financial statements, particularly the accounting policies and disclosures regarding financial instruments. Check whether any financial assets have been classified as FVPL based on designation and not inherently required by IFRS 9 (e.g., derivatives). Look at IFRS 9 criteria for classification decisions.

yes_case.question: Has the entity determined the change in fair value attributable to changes in the credit risk of the financial asset or group of financial assets for the current period and cumulatively?
yes_case.guidance: Review the entity's calculations—check for methodologies such as isolating credit risk-related fair value changes from market risk-related changes. Validate against the requirements stated in IFRS 7.36(a) and IFRS 7.36(b), ensuring either the recommended approach or a faithful alternative method is used.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose, in its financial statements, the amount of change in fair value attributable to credit risk during the period and cumulatively, as required by IFRS 7.36(a) and IFRS 7.36(b)?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the notes to the financial statements where disclosures of financial instruments are detailed. Confirm that the entity discloses both the current period and cumulative changes, ensuring clarity and transparency regarding the impact of credit risk on fair value.

items.question: Has the entity designated a financial asset or group of financial assets as measured at fair value through profit or loss that would otherwise be measured at fair value through other comprehensive income or amortised cost?
items.original_question: If the entity has designated a financial asset (or group of financial assets) as measured at fair value through profit or loss that would otherwise be measured at fair value through other comprehensive income or amortised cost, does it disclose the amount of the change in the fair value of any related credit derivatives or similar instruments that has occurred during the reporting period and cumulatively since the financial asset was designated

decision_tree.question: Has the entity designated a financial asset or group of financial assets as measured at fair value through profit or loss that would otherwise be measured at fair value through other comprehensive income or amortised cost?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's accounting policies and financial statements (particularly notes on financial instruments). Check whether any financial assets that would otherwise qualify for fair value through other comprehensive income or amortised cost have been explicitly designated by the entity as measured at fair value through profit or loss.

yes_case.question: Does the entity hold any related credit derivatives or similar instruments for the designated financial assets?
yes_case.guidance: Inspect disclosures regarding financial instruments to identify any related credit derivatives or similar instruments tied to the financial assets designated at fair value through profit or loss. Cross-check with the notes on hedging activities or risk management to confirm the existence of such instruments.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the amount of the change in the fair value of the related credit derivatives or similar instruments, both during the reporting period and cumulatively since the designation?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the financial statement disclosures. Specifically, verify if the entity provides the changes in fair value for the reporting period and cumulative changes since designation for related credit derivatives or similar instruments, as required by IFRS 7.36(a) and IFRS 7.36(b).

items.question: Has the entity designated a financial liability as at fair value through profit or loss in accordance with IFRS 9.4.2.2?
items.original_question: If the entity (a) has designated a financial liability as at fair value through profit or loss in accordance with IFRS 9.4.2.2 and (b) is required to present the effects of changes in that liability's credit risk in other comprehensive income (see IFRS 9.5.7.7) does it disclose: a. The amount of change, cumulatively, in the fair value of the financial liability that is attributable to changes in the credit risk of that liability b. The difference between the financial liability’s carrying amount and the amount the entity would be contractually required to pay at maturity to the holder of the obligation c. Any transfers of the cumulative gain or loss within equity during the reporting period, including the reason for such transfers d. If a liability is derecognised during the reporting period, the amount (if any) presented in other comprehensive income that was realised at derecognition

decision_tree.question: Has the entity designated a financial liability as at fair value through profit or loss in accordance with IFRS 9.4.2.2?
decision_tree.guidance: Check if the entity explicitly applies the option to designate a financial liability under IFRS 9.4.2.2. This is typically disclosed in the accounting policies section of the financial statements and supported by evidence in the financial records. Verify that this does not pertain to liabilities mandatorily measured at fair value such as derivatives.

yes_case.question: Is the entity required to present the effects of changes in the liability's credit risk in other comprehensive income in accordance with IFRS 9.5.7.7?
yes_case.guidance: Review the relevant disclosures for financial liabilities. If the entity is required to distinguish between changes in fair value due to credit risk and other factors, confirm compliance using IFRS 9.5.7.7 and related application guidance such as IFRS 9.B5.7.13.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the cumulative amount of change in fair value attributable to changes in the credit risk of the liability?
yes_case.guidance: Check the financial statements, specifically the notes on financial liabilities, for disclosure of the cumulative change in fair value attributable to credit risk. This disclosure should align with IFRS 7.10(a) and IFRS 9.5.7.20.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the difference between the financial liability's carrying amount and the amount the entity would be contractually required to pay at maturity to the holder of the obligation?
yes_case.guidance: Review IFRS 7.10(b) and confirm that the difference between the carrying amount and contractual payment amount is explicitly stated. Focus on maturity terms per IFRS 9.5.7.20.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose any transfers of cumulative gain or loss within equity during the reporting period, including the reason for such transfers?
yes_case.guidance: Check disclosures in the equity section and notes for specific details about transfers of cumulative gain or loss and reasons for such transfers, as specified in IFRS 9.5.7.8.

yes_case.question: If a liability was derecognised during the reporting period, does the entity disclose the amount (if any) presented in other comprehensive income that was realised at derecognition?
yes_case.guidance: Determine if the financial liability was derecognised in the reporting period (review derecognition notes or events). If applicable, verify that amounts realised and previously presented in OCI are disclosed per IFRS 9.B5.7.5-7.

items.question: Has the entity designated any financial liabilities as at fair value through profit or loss in accordance with IFRS 9.4.2.2?
items.original_question: If the entity (a) has designated a financial liability as at fair value through profit or loss in accordance with IFRS 9.4.2.2 and (b) is required to present all changes in the fair value of that liability (including the effects of changes in the credit risk of the liability) in profit or loss (see IFRS 9.5.7.7-8) does it disclose: a. The amount of change, during the period and cumulatively, in the fair value of the financial liability that is attributable to changes in the credit risk of that liability b. The difference between the financial liability’s carrying amount and the amount the entity would be contractually required to pay at maturity to the holder of the obligation

decision_tree.question: Has the entity designated any financial liabilities as at fair value through profit or loss in accordance with IFRS 9.4.2.2?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial statements and accounting policies to determine if any financial liabilities have been explicitly designated at fair value through profit or loss. Check for such disclosures in the 'Significant Accounting Policies' section and consider whether such designations align with IFRS 9.4.2.2 requirements.

yes_case.question: Is the entity required to present all changes in the fair value of the financial liability, including the effects of changes in the credit risk of the liability, in profit or loss in accordance with IFRS 9.5.7.7-8?
yes_case.guidance: Review the application of IFRS 9.5.7.7-8 in the entity's financial reporting. Verify that the entity calculates and reports changes in fair value, including the portion attributable to credit risk. Check transactional or valuation documentation for compliance.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose: (a) the amount of change, during the period and cumulatively, in the fair value of the financial liability attributable to changes in the credit risk of that liability, AND (b) the difference between the liability’s carrying amount and the amount contractually required to be paid at maturity?
yes_case.guidance: Confirm that the financial statements explicitly disclose both required elements. Look in the notes to the financial statements or any applicable sections discussing financial liabilities. Ensure each part is clearly reported and aligns with IFRS 7.10A disclosure requirements.

items.question: Does the entity have financial assets or financial liabilities measured at fair value, or designated under IFRS 9 as measured at fair value through profit or loss (FVTPL)?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose: a. A detailed description of the methods used to comply with the requirements in IFRS 7.9(c), 10(a) and 10A(a) and IFRS 9.5.7.7(a), including an explanation of why the method is appropriate b. If the entity believes that the disclosure it has given, either in the statement of financial position or in the notes, to comply with the requirements in IFRS 7.9(c), 10(a) and 10A(a) or IFRS 9.5.7.7(a) does not faithfully represent the change in the fair value of the financial asset or financial liability attributable to changes in its credit risk: ► The reasons for reaching this conclusion ► The factors the entity believes are relevant c. A detailed description of the methodology or methodologies used to determine whether presenting the effects of changes in a liability’s credit risk in other comprehensive income would create or enlarge an accounting mismatch in profit or loss d. If the entity is required to present the effects of changes in a liability’s credit risk in profit or loss (to comply with c. above), the disclosure must include a detailed description of the economic relationship described in IFRS 9.B5.7.6

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have financial assets or financial liabilities measured at fair value, or designated under IFRS 9 as measured at fair value through profit or loss (FVTPL)?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's statement of financial position and related notes to identify if financial assets or liabilities are measured at fair value. Check designation criteria applied under IFRS 9, particularly IFRS 9.5.7.7(a).

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose a detailed description of the methods used to comply with requirements in IFRS 7.9(c), 10(a), and 10A(a) and IFRS 9.5.7.7(a), including an explanation of why the methods are appropriate?
yes_case.guidance: Review the notes accompanying the financial statements to ensure the entity has described the methods for compliance, addressing why each method is relevant and appropriate as per IFRS 9 guidelines.

yes_case.question: Does the entity provide reasons if it believes the disclosure does not faithfully represent the change in the fair value of the financial asset or liability attributable to changes in its credit risk?
yes_case.guidance: Verify whether the notes to the financial statements include a justification for this belief, citing reasons and relevant factors as required by IFRS 7.11.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose a detailed description of the methodology used to determine if presenting the effects of changes in a liability’s credit risk in other comprehensive income would create or enlarge an accounting mismatch?
yes_case.guidance: Inspect the notes for an explanation of methodologies used, ensuring alignment with the requirements in IFRS 9.B5.7.7 and IFRS 9.B5.7.8. Focus on the assessment of accounting mismatches in profit or loss.

yes_case.question: If required to present credit risk changes in profit or loss, does the entity disclose a detailed description of the economic relationship described in IFRS 9.B5.7.6?
yes_case.guidance: Check whether the entity has described how changes in a liability's credit risk impact the profit or loss, demonstrating compliance with IFRS 9.B5.7.6 guidelines.

items.question: Has the entity designated any investments in equity instruments to be measured at fair value through other comprehensive income (FVOCI), as permitted by IFRS 9.5.7.5?
items.original_question: If an entity does not apply the Amendments to IFRS 9 and IFRS 7 in Amendments to the Classification and Measurement of Financial Instruments, issued May 2024, and the entity designated investments in equity instruments to be measured at fair value through other comprehensive income, as permitted by IFRS 9.5.7.5, does it disclose: a. Which investments in equity instruments have been designated to be measured at fair value through other comprehensive income b. The reasons for using this presentation alternative c. The fair value of each such investment at the end of the reporting period d. Dividends recognised during the period, showing separately: ► Those related to investments derecognised during the reporting period ► Those related to investments held at the end of the reporting period e. Any transfers of the cumulative gain or loss within equity during the reporting period and the reason for such transfers

decision_tree.question: Has the entity designated any investments in equity instruments to be measured at fair value through other comprehensive income (FVOCI), as permitted by IFRS 9.5.7.5?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements and accompanying notes. Check whether the entity has chosen the FVOCI classification for investments in equity instruments. This designation must be documented as part of their accounting policy for financial instruments. Refer to IFRS 9.5.7.5 for the specific criteria for this classification.

yes_case.question: Does the entity apply the Amendments to IFRS 9 and IFRS 7 in Amendments to the Classification and Measurement of Financial Instruments, issued May 2024?
yes_case.guidance: Verify whether the entity has early adopted or applied the May 2024 Amendments. Review the entity's accounting policies note or disclosures related to financial instruments. If the entity applies these amendments, the specific disclosures outlined in IFRS 7.11A might differ.

no_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the following for investments in equity instruments designated at FVOCI: (a) Which investments have been designated as FVOCI, (b) Reasons for using this method, (c) Fair value of each investment at the end of the reporting period, (d) Dividends recognised during the period (distinguishing between derecognised and held investments), (e) Transfers of cumulative gain or loss within equity and reasons for such transfers?
no_case.guidance: Check the entity's financial statement disclosures, particularly the notes on financial instruments and equity investments. Ensure all information specified in IFRS 7.11A is included for equity instruments designated under FVOCI. Common pitfalls include incomplete disclosure of reasons for designation or failure to distinguish dividends between derecognised and held investments.

items.original_question: If an entity does not apply the Amendments to IFRS 9 and IFRS 7 in Amendments to the Classification and Measurement of Financial Instruments, issued May 2024, and the entity derecognises investments in equity instruments measured at fair value through other comprehensive income during the reporting period, does it disclose: a. decision_tree.question: Did the entity derecognise investments in equity instruments measured at fair value through other comprehensive income during the reporting period?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements, particularly the equity investments classified as 'fair value through other comprehensive income' under IFRS 9. Check whether these investments were sold, exchanged, or otherwise derecognised during the reporting period. This information could be found in the Statement of Financial Position, Statement of Changes in Equity, or related notes. Beware of misclassifications of equity investments.

yes_case.question: Has the entity opted NOT to apply the Amendments to IFRS 9 and IFRS 7 issued in May 2024?
yes_case.guidance: Check the accounting policies note in the financial statements or disclosures related to financial instruments to see if the entity has applied these amendments. If the amendments were applied, the requirements in IFRS 7.11B no longer apply.

yes_case.question: Does the disclosure include: a. The reasons for disposing of the investments, b. The fair value of the investments at the date of derecognition, c. The cumulative gain or loss on disposal?
yes_case.guidance: Review the financial instruments disclosures and specifically look for information related to equity investments derecognised during the reporting period. Ensure these three elements are disclosed fully, as required by IFRS 7.11B. Cross-check notes against the details provided in the derecognition transactions.

items.question: Has the entity adopted the Amendments to IFRS 9 and IFRS 7 in Amendments to the Classification and Measurement of Financial Instruments issued in May 2024?
items.original_question: If an entity applies the Amendments to IFRS 9 and IFRS 7 in Amendments to the Classification and Measurement of Financial Instruments, issued May 2024, and the entity designated investments in equity instruments to be measured at fair value through other comprehensive income, as permitted by IFRS 9.5.7.5, does it disclose for each class of investment: a. The fair value gain or loss presented in other comprehensive income during the period, showing separately the fair value gain or loss related to investments derecognised during the reporting period and the fair value gain or loss related to investments held at the end of the reporting period

decision_tree.question: Has the entity adopted the Amendments to IFRS 9 and IFRS 7 in Amendments to the Classification and Measurement of Financial Instruments issued in May 2024?
decision_tree.guidance: Check the entity's accounting policies or disclosures in the financial statements to confirm if these amendments have been adopted. Look for explicit references to IFRS 9 and IFRS 7 amendments issued in May 2024. Ensure this application is effective for the reporting entity's financial year.

yes_case.question: Has the entity designated any investments in equity instruments to be measured at fair value through other comprehensive income (FVOCI) in accordance with IFRS 9.5.7.5?
yes_case.guidance: Review the entity’s financial assets disclosure. Look for any classification or election of equity investments measured at FVOCI as permitted by IFRS 9.5.7.5. Ensure these are properly disclosed in accounting policies and financial instruments classifications.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the required details for each class of investment designated as FVOCI, including: a) which investments are designated, b) reasons for the designation, c) fair value at reporting date, d) dividends recognised (with breakdown of derecognised and held investments), e) any transfers of cumulative gain or loss, and f) the fair value gains or losses (with breakdown of derecognised and held investments)?
yes_case.guidance: Check the disclosures within the financial statements, particularly under 'financial instruments note' or 'investment in equity instruments note'. Confirm that the entity addresses each disclosure requirement explicitly for each class of equity instrument. Cross-check against IFRS 7.11A to validate completeness.

items.original_question: If an entity applies the Amendments to IFRS 9 and IFRS 7 in Amendments to the Classification and Measurement of Financial Instruments, issued May 2024, and the entity derecognises investments in equity instruments measured at fair value through other comprehensive income during the reporting period, does it disclose: a. Any transfers of the cumulative gain or loss within equity during the reporting period related to the investments derecognised during that reporting period

decision_tree.question: Has the entity early adopted the Amendments to IFRS 9 and IFRS 7 issued in May 2024?
decision_tree.guidance: Check the entity's accounting policies disclosed in the financial statements, particularly the section discussing IFRS standards adoption. Ensure that the Amendments to IFRS 9 and IFRS 7 regarding the Classification and Measurement of Financial Instruments are explicitly mentioned as being early adopted.

yes_case.question: Has the entity derecognised investments in equity instruments measured at fair value through other comprehensive income (FVOCI) during the reporting period?
yes_case.guidance: Review the Statement of Financial Position to identify any derecognition of equity investments classified as FVOCI and confirm transactions in the notes to the financial statements. Look for movements relating to these investments, such as disposals or transfers out of FVOCI.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the following details for derecognised equity investments measured at FVOCI: a. Reasons for the disposals b. Fair value at the date of derecognition c. Cumulative gain or loss on disposal d. Transfers of cumulative gain or loss within equity?
yes_case.guidance: Check the disclosures in the notes to the financial statements. Specifically, locate where derecognition of equity investments in FVOCI is discussed. Verify that detailed disclosures include all four required elements outlined in IFRS 7.11B: reasons for disposal, fair value at derecognition, cumulative gains/losses, and equity transfers.

items.question: Has the entity reclassified any financial assets under IFRS 9.4.4.1 during the reporting period?
items.original_question: For financial assets reclassified under IFRS 9.4.4.1, does the entity disclose the date of reclassification?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity reclassified any financial assets under IFRS 9.4.4.1 during the reporting period?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial statements and accounting policy disclosures for evidence of reclassification of financial assets. IFRS 9.4.4.1 allows reclassification when there is a change in the entity’s business model for managing financial assets. Verify any relevant notes in the financial statements concerning reclassification.

yes_case.question: Did the entity disclose the date of reclassification in accordance with IFRS 7.12B?
yes_case.guidance: Check the notes to the financial statements, specifically disclosures related to financial instruments, for the specific date of reclassification. Ensure the disclosure is explicit and aligns with IFRS 7.12B requirements. Common pitfall: Vague or omitted dates.

items.question: Has the entity reclassified financial assets under IFRS 9.4.4.1 during the reporting period?
items.original_question: For financial assets reclassified under IFRS 9.4.4.1, does the entity disclose a detailed explanation of the change in business model and its effect on the financial statements?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity reclassified financial assets under IFRS 9.4.4.1 during the reporting period?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity’s financial records and management documentation to determine whether financial assets have been reclassified during the reporting period. Check Board decisions, accounting policies, and any disclosures regarding a change in business model as per IFRS 9.4.4.1.

yes_case.question: Does the entity provide a detailed explanation of the change in business model that led to the reclassification and its effect on the financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Review the notes to the financial statements and disclosures under IFRS 7.12B. The explanation should include the rationale behind the change in business model and how it impacted the reclassification, including changes to the measurement or classification of the financial assets.

items.question: Has the entity reclassified any financial assets under IFRS 9.4.4.1?
items.original_question: For financial assets reclassified under IFRS 9.4.4.1, does the entity disclose the amount reclassified into and out of each category?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity reclassified any financial assets under IFRS 9.4.4.1?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's reclassification decisions for financial assets during the reporting period. Specifically, check whether financial assets previously categorized under IFRS 9 have been reclassified between measurement categories (e.g., from amortized cost to fair value through profit or loss (FVPL), or vice versa). Verify that such reclassifications are mentioned in the entity's accounting policies or financial statement disclosures.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the amount reclassified into and out of each category as required by IFRS 7.12B?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the disclosures in the financial statements related to IFRS 7.12B. Ensure amounts reclassified into and out of each category (e.g., amortized cost, FVPL, or fair value through other comprehensive income (FVOCI)) are clearly disclosed. Pay attention to whether all categories affected by reclassification are specified and amounts are transparent.

items.question: Did the entity reclassify any financial assets from amortised cost to fair value through profit or loss during the reporting period?
items.original_question: For financial assets reclassified from amortised cost to fair value through profit or loss, does the entity disclose any gain or loss arising from the difference between previous amortised cost and fair value at reclassification?

decision_tree.question: Did the entity reclassify any financial assets from amortised cost to fair value through profit or loss during the reporting period?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the accounting policies and notes to the financial statements for disclosures regarding reclassification of financial assets. Specifically, check IFRS 9.5.6.1 for conditions under which reclassification is permitted. Look for any mention of financial assets moving between these two categories.

yes_case.question: Was there a gain or loss arising from the difference between the previous amortised cost and the fair value at the date of reclassification?
yes_case.guidance: Check the supporting documentation for the reclassification transaction. Review the calculation of the fair value and compare it to the previous amortised cost. Common areas of concern include errors in valuation or failure to document the impact of reclassification.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the gain or loss arising from the difference between the previous amortised cost and fair value at reclassification in accordance with IFRS 7.12B?
yes_case.guidance: Ensure that the disclosure includes specific reference to the gain or loss amount and is presented clearly in the financial statement notes. Verify compliance with IFRS 7.12B requirements: the disclosure should clearly link the gain or loss to the reclassification event.

items.question: Has the entity reclassified financial assets from fair value through other comprehensive income (FVOCI) to fair value through profit or loss (FVTPL)?
items.original_question: For financial assets reclassified from fair value through other comprehensive income to fair value through profit or loss, does the entity disclose any cumulative gain or loss previously in OCI that is reclassified to profit or loss?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity reclassified financial assets from fair value through other comprehensive income (FVOCI) to fair value through profit or loss (FVTPL)?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial statements, particularly disclosures under IFRS 9. Focus on any reclassification adjustments for financial assets under FVOCI and FVTPL. Cross-check by examining changes reported in the statement of financial position and notes accompanying the financial statements. Ensure to verify the conditions for reclassification as per IFRS 9.

yes_case.question: Did the entity reclassify any cumulative gain or loss previously recognized in OCI to profit or loss as a result of the reclassification?
yes_case.guidance: Inspect the statement of profit or loss and other comprehensive income (OCI section) and relevant notes for disclosures of cumulative gains or losses that were moved out of OCI to profit or loss. Pay attention to any narrative descriptions in the disclosures and ensure these comply with IFRS 7.12B.

yes_case.question: Did the entity disclose the cumulative gain or loss reclassified from OCI to profit or loss?
yes_case.guidance: Check the notes to the financial statements for explicit disclosure of the cumulative gain or loss. The disclosure should be complete and follow IFRS 7.12B guidelines. Ensure no material information has been omitted and verify compliance.

items.question: Has the entity reclassified any financial assets from fair value through profit or loss to amortised cost or fair value through other comprehensive income during the reporting period?
items.original_question: For assets reclassified from fair value through profit or loss to amortised cost or fair value through other comprehensive income, does the entity disclose the effective interest rate determined on the date of reclassification?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity reclassified any financial assets from fair value through profit or loss to amortised cost or fair value through other comprehensive income during the reporting period?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements and reclassification notes. Check if any financial assets were reclassified per IFRS 9.4.4.1. Look for records of reclassification events and associated changes in measurement category. Avoid assuming reclassifications unless documented explicitly.

yes_case.question: Was the effective interest rate determined on the date of reclassification for the reclassified financial assets?
yes_case.guidance: Verify disclosures in the notes to the financial statements. Look for the effective interest rate calculation under IFRS 7.12C. Ensure this determination happened at the moment of reclassification and is adequately documented.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed this effective interest rate in its financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Inspect the financial statement disclosures, including the notes related to financial instruments as required by IFRS 7. Ensure the effective interest rate is clearly presented for the reclassified assets. Cross-check the disclosure for completeness and accuracy.

items.question: Has the entity reclassified any financial assets from fair value through profit or loss to amortised cost or fair value through other comprehensive income during the reporting period?
items.original_question: For assets reclassified from fair value through profit or loss to amortised cost or fair value through other comprehensive income, does the entity disclose the interest revenue recognised?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity reclassified any financial assets from fair value through profit or loss to amortised cost or fair value through other comprehensive income during the reporting period?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements, particularly the disclosures related to financial asset classifications under IFRS 9.4.4.1. Check for reclassification notes, which are typically disclosed either in the notes to the accounts or under changes in accounting policies.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the interest revenue recognised for the reclassified financial assets?
yes_case.guidance: Refer to IFRS 7.12C for disclosure requirements. Inspect the entity's notes to the financial statements, specifically the section that addresses financial assets. Ensure that interest revenue disclosure includes amounts recognised and the calculation basis. Common pitfall: Failure to include the basis used for determining interest revenue.

items.question: Has the entity reclassified any financial assets from fair value through OCI, from fair value through profit or loss, or to amortised cost since the last annual reporting date?
items.original_question: For financial assets reclassified from fair value through OCI to amortised cost or from fair value through profit or loss to amortised cost/FVOCI since last annual reporting date, does the entity disclose their fair value at period end?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity reclassified any financial assets from fair value through OCI, from fair value through profit or loss, or to amortised cost since the last annual reporting date?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial asset reclassifications during the current reporting period. Check reclassification notes in the financial statements and compare with the prior year's classification for any changes. Focus on movements between fair value through OCI, fair value through profit or loss, and amortised cost.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the fair value of the reclassified financial assets at the period end, as required?
yes_case.guidance: Locate the note disclosures relating to reclassified financial assets. Verify that the fair value of these assets at the end of the reporting period is disclosed separately, as per IFRS 7.12D. Ensure the disclosure aligns with the requirements for transparency about fair value.

items.question: Does the entity have any financial assets that were reclassified during the reporting period under IFRS 9?
items.original_question: For such reclassified financial assets, does the entity disclose the fair value gain/loss that would have been recognised in profit or loss or OCI during the period if they had not been reclassified?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have any financial assets that were reclassified during the reporting period under IFRS 9?
decision_tree.guidance: Check the notes to the financial statements, including the entity's disclosures about financial instruments (IFRS 7). Look specifically for any mention of financial assets being reclassified, either due to a change in business model or other criteria under IFRS 9. Ensure that the reclassification relates to the reporting period and is not historical.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the fair value gain or loss that would have been recognised in profit or loss or OCI if the financial assets had not been reclassified?
yes_case.guidance: Review the disclosure requirements under IFRS 7.12D. Confirm that the fair value gain or loss for each reclassified financial asset is presented clearly, specifying the amounts that would have been recognised in the profit or loss or other comprehensive income (OCI) during the reporting period. Avoid overlooking cases where amounts are aggregated without proper detail.

items.question: Does the entity hold financial assets or liabilities whose fair value is treated as amortised cost as of the date of initial application of IFRS 9?
items.original_question: If an entity treats the fair value of a financial asset or liability as its amortised cost at the date of initial application of IFRS 9, does it make the disclosures in IFRS 7.42N for each reporting period until derecognition?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity hold financial assets or liabilities whose fair value is treated as amortised cost as of the date of initial application of IFRS 9?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial instruments accounting under IFRS 9. Look for assets/liabilities transitioning from IAS 39 to IFRS 9 where the fair value at transition was classified as amortised cost under IFRS 9. Check supporting documentation (e.g., transition disclosures, financial instrument classifications).

yes_case.question: Has the entity derecognised those financial assets or liabilities during the reporting period?
yes_case.guidance: Check whether the financial assets or liabilities in question have been removed from the financial statements during the reporting period. Refer to the derecognition criteria in IFRS 9 (e.g., IFRS 9.3.2). Common pitfalls include incorrect assumptions about transfer of risk or control over the asset.

no_case.question: Does the entity make the disclosures required by IFRS 7.42N for those financial assets or liabilities that are treated as amortised cost?
no_case.guidance: Verify disclosures in the financial statements. IFRS 7.42N requires entities to disclose the initial fair value treated as amortised cost, reasons for the classification, and the effects on the financial position. Ensure proper detailing for users of financial statements, particularly investors.

items.question: Does the entity prepare financial statements in accordance with IFRS standards?
items.original_question: Does the entity present the disclosures required by IFRS 7.42B–42H in a single note in its financial statements?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity prepare financial statements in accordance with IFRS standards?
decision_tree.guidance: Verify the framework used for financial reporting in the entity's financial statements. Check the introductory notes or basis of preparation section to confirm compliance with IFRS standards. Non-compliance with IFRS standards would make this question not applicable.

yes_case.question: Is the entity required to apply IFRS 9, Financial Instruments, as part of its financial reporting framework?
yes_case.guidance: Review the nature of the entity's operations and financial reporting requirements. Entities dealing with financial instruments such as loans, receivables, investments, or derivatives typically apply IFRS 9. Check significant accounting policies disclosed in the financial statements for references to IFRS 9.

yes_case.question: Does the entity present disclosures related to expected credit losses, hedge accounting, or reclassification under IFRS 9 in its financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Verify the financial statement notes for any disclosures concerning expected credit losses, hedge accounting, or reclassification of financial instruments. These topics are governed by IFRS 7.42B–42H and would indicate applicability.

yes_case.question: Are the disclosures required by IFRS 7.42B–42H presented in a single note in the financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the financial statements to confirm that disclosures related to IFRS 7.42B–42H (expected credit losses, hedge accounting, reclassification, etc.) are grouped into a single note. This should ensure clarity and compliance with IFRS guidance on disclosure structure.

items.question: Has the entity transferred financial assets during the reporting period?
items.original_question: For each class of transferred financial assets not derecognised in their entirety, does the entity disclose the nature of the transferred assets?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity transferred financial assets during the reporting period?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial statements and transaction records for evidence of any transferred financial assets. Look for sections or notes referencing transfer or sale agreements. Ensure consideration of all types of financial assets, e.g., trade receivables, loans, etc.

yes_case.question: Were any of the transferred financial assets not derecognised in their entirety?
yes_case.guidance: Check whether the entity retains risks and rewards or control over the transferred financial assets, even after the transfer. Refer specifically to IFRS 9.3.2.6(c)(ii) and IFRS 9.3.2.16 for criteria on derecognition and continuing involvement.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the nature of the transferred financial assets for each applicable class?
yes_case.guidance: Review the disclosures in the notes to the financial statements concerning transferred financial assets not derecognised. Look for clear descriptions of the asset classes, including key characteristics of the assets as outlined in IFRS 7.42D.

items.question: Does the entity have transferred financial assets that are not derecognised in their entirety?
items.original_question: For each class of transferred financial assets not derecognised in their entirety, does the entity disclose the nature of the risks and rewards of ownership to which it remains exposed?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have transferred financial assets that are not derecognised in their entirety?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements and note whether the entity has transferred financial assets. Focus on sections related to derecognition criteria under IFRS 9. These assets should still be recognized on the entity’s balance sheet, implying the transfer did not qualify for derecognition (e.g., due to retained control or risks and rewards). Check IFRS 9.3.2.6(c)(ii) and IFRS 9.3.2.16 for criteria.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the nature of the risks and rewards of ownership to which it remains exposed?

yes_case.question: Were the transferred financial assets derecognised in their entirety?

no_case.question: Does the entity describe the relationship between the transferred financial assets and associated liabilities, including any restrictions on the use of the transferred assets?

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose a schedule of the fair value of transferred assets, fair value of associated liabilities, and the net position in the financial statements?

yes_case.question: Does the entity retain any control over the transferred financial assets?
yes_case.guidance: Review the transfer agreement or arrangement. Control is retained if the entity retains the right to some benefits (e.g., future cash flows) or bears some risks (e.g., credit risk). Refer to IFRS 9.3.2.6(c)(ii) for the criteria of retained control.

yes_case.question: Does the entity continue to recognize all transferred financial assets in the financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Confirm whether the transferred assets are derecognized or remain fully recognized by checking the statement of financial position and related disclosures. Retained control generally leads to continued recognition under IFRS 9.3.2.16.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the carrying amounts of the transferred assets and associated liabilities?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the financial statement notes for disclosures on transfers of financial assets. According to IFRS 7.42D, the entity must disclose the amounts and nature of both the recognized transferred assets and the liabilities incurred as part of the transfer.

yes_case.question: Does the entity continue to recognize these assets to the extent of its continuing involvement?

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the total carrying amount of the original assets, the carrying amount it continues to recognize, and the carrying amount of associated liabilities?
yes_case.guidance: Verify the disclosures in the notes to the financial statements as required by IFRS 7.42D. Look for clear and specific details regarding the total carrying amount of the derecognized assets, the portion that the entity continues to recognize, and any liabilities associated with the continuing involvement. Ensure that these items are presented transparently.

yes_case.question: Does the entity retain continuing involvement with the transferred financial assets?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the transaction documentation and agreements for provisions indicating continuing involvement, such as guarantees, repurchase agreements, or servicing rights, as outlined in IFRS 9.3.2.6(c)(i). Ensure all forms of continuing involvement are identified.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the carrying amount of assets and liabilities representing the continuing involvement and their line items in the statement of financial position?

yes_case.question: Were the transferred financial assets derecognised in their entirety from the entity's financial statements?

yes_case.question: Does the entity retain any continuing involvement in the transferred financial assets?

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the fair value of the assets and liabilities representing continuing involvement?

yes_case.question: Has the entity derecognised the transferred financial assets in their entirety?

yes_case.question: Does the entity have continuing involvement with the transferred financial assets?

Carefully analyze agreements and disclosures for any sign of continuing involvement.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the amount that best represents its maximum exposure to loss from the continuing involvement and explain how that exposure is determined?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the entity's financial statement notes and disclosures for compliance with IFRS 7.42E. Confirm that the amount disclosed reflects the highest possible loss related to the continuing involvement and is accompanied by a clear explanation of the calculation method.

decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial records and transaction logs for any evidence of transferred financial assets.
